newsitem.title: UK: BA cargo staff vote for pay freeze/jobs plan.
newsitem.headline: BA cargo staff vote for pay freeze/jobs plan.

text.p: Staff at British Airways World Cargo on Thursday voted overwhelmingly in favour of plans by the UK airline to establish the business as a world class freight carrier.

The airline said in a statement that three-quarters of the staff voted in favour of the deal, whose proposals include a two-year pay freeze and loss of 400 jobs from the current work force over the next two years.

The airline said it hopes the job losses, which will occur as automation increases at its 150 million stg World Cargocentre at Heathrow, can be achieved through voluntary severance, redeployment or early retirement.
BA said the ballot result will "enable the company to protect jobs into the next century".
The staff's endorsement represents a further step forward in the airline's Business Efficiency Programme.
Agreements have already been reached in other areas, including thousands of customer service staff at Heathrow and Gatwick.

In March, ground services staff at the Aircraft Services department at Heathrow voted in favour of a pay freeze and lower rates for new recruits in return for a commitment to protect jobs if efficiencies are achieved.
BA hopes a ballot by Cabin Crew 89, which closes today, will also endorse efficiency plans.
